intro: Pasania daphnoidea, commonly known as the white-flowered pasania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
